Description: Body sherd of Chian Sphinx and Lion Style pottery plate; white slip; glaze fired red; interior, from outside: maeander frieze; two lines; black-figure frieze consisting of sphinx with added red on hair, to left; part of rosette and pendant rosette with red dot as filling ornament; exterior: two sets of three bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2144) (phase 2)
